text: Charles Henry Coolidge (August 4, 1921 - April 6, 2021)WWII Army Enlistment Records was a United States Army soldier. He was awarded the United States military's highest decorationâ€”the Medal of Honor. He received this honor for his actions in World War II. He was the oldest living person to have been given the Medal of Honor at the time of his death. Coolidge died on April 6, 2021 at his home in Chattanooga, Tennessee from problems caused by multiple sclerosis, aged 99. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Military people from Tennessee Category:Medal of Honor recipients Category:Deaths from multiple sclerosis
title: Charles H. Coolidge
